Personal diary of Steve Simon
  • About Steve Simon

Captain’s Log. Star Date 2025-09-13

Movies
Published

September 13, 2025

2025

The year is not done yet. Among the live movies, “The Life of Chuck” is my favorite. It’s based on a Stephen King short story, but does not have the creepiness or gore that you might expect. Instead, it is a sweet and somewhat sad movie. The first third of the movie is somewhat confusing, especially if you did not read the story first.

For the virtual movie group, “Play It Again, Sam” is one of my favorites of all time. I saw it as a teenager and related very closely to the Woody Allen character who struck out repeatedly in the dating scene. The others in the movie group did not like it as well as I did, which is okay.

  • Live movie group
    • Sep 2025: Hamilton
    • Aug 2025: Sorry, Baby
    • Jul 2025: The Life of Chuck
    • Jun 2025: Jane Austen Wrecked My Life
    • May 2025: That They May Face the Rising Sun
    • Apr 2025: The Penguin Lessons
    • Mar 2025: The Rule Breakers
    • Feb 2025: September 5
    • Jan 2025: A Complete Unknown
  • Virtual movie group
    • Aug 2025: 9 to 5
    • Jul 2025: Yentl
    • Jun 2025: Almost Famous
    • May 2025: Mrs. Doubtfire
    • Apr 2025: Big
    • Mar 2025: Hoosiers
    • Feb 2025: The Way We Were
    • Jan 2025: Play It Again Sam

2024

The big movie of the year was “Wicked”, but a sleeper that was actually quite good was “American Fiction”. Two virtual movie group choices which have reached cult status are “Back to the Future” and “Ferris Bueller’s Day Off”.

    • Dec 2024: Wicked
    • Nov 2024: Here

    • Feb 2024: The Wedding Singer
    • Jan 2024: The Horse Whisperer

2023

A Christmas film that rivals so many of the others, “The Holdovers”, is the best among some very good live films. By popular demand for the virtual movie group, we rewatched something that we had seen several years before in the live movie group, “Big Sonia”. This is a film that is hard to find, but well worth watching if you can find it.

  • Live movie group
    • Dec 2023: The Holdovers
    • Nov 2023: Killers of the Flower Moon

2022

After a 19 month gap, we returned to watching live movies. It was nice to watch the big screen, and see everyone face-to-face again. Among the virtual movie group choices, “All of Me” stands out. Steve Martin plays a role where he has to physically act as a woman inhabiting inside a man’s body, and his physical movements and gestures add greatly to the humor.

  • Live movie group
    • Dec 2022: The Fabelmans
    • Nov 2022: She Said
    • Oct 2022: Ticket to Paradise

    • Jan 2022: Love Actually

2021

In January, still in the depths of Covid isolation, the movie group members asked if we could meet twice a month. There certainly are enough movies out there to do this. My favorite film by far among the 24 we saw in 2021 is “Breaking Away”. Many others might list “The Princess Bride” as their favorite film of all time.

  • Virtual movie group
    • Dec 2021: White Christmas
    • Dec 2021: O Brother Where Art Thou?

    • Jan 2021: Airplane
    • Jan 2021: Joyeaux Noel

2020

In March 2020, the Covid crisis had gotten serious enough to cancel the live movie group. We would not restart again until late in 2022. We switched to a virtual movie format in April. Several people in the group had trouble at first with getting Zoom to work, but after a few months, everything went smoothly.

  • Live movie group
    • Mar 2020 through Sep 2022: Cancelled
    • Feb 2020: Downhill
    • Jan 2020: Just Mercy
  • Virtual movie group
    • Dec 2020: A Christmas Story
    • Nov 2020: Charade
    • Oct 2020: The African Queen
    • Sep 2020: The Blues Brothers
    • Aug 2020: When Harry Met Sally
    • Jul 2020: Desk Set
    • Jun 2020: Groundhog Day
    • May 2020: North By Northwest
    • Apr 2020: Monty Python’s Life of Brian
